value.title: DAX! Uggg - Where do you start? | Power BI
value.excerpt: Not a coder? Don't understand DAX syntax? DAX can be intimidating and difficult to learn. Frustrating even! Learning DAX can make Power BI very rewarding. Adam has some resources to get you started in your journey.  Beginning the journey:  MS Learn: User DAX in Power BI Desktop (Free) https://docs.microsoft.com/learn/paths/dax-power-bi/
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/3gpXMMRJjw8" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Demystifying Custom Partitions in Power BI
value.excerpt: We talk about Incremental Refresh a lot, but what if you need custom partitions in Power BI? How do you even create those? They look scary! Patrick takes the mystery away and walks you through how you can create them.  Partitions in tabular models https://docs.microsoft.com/analysis-services/tabular-models/partitions-ssas-tabular
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/6CRqdsLjHNA" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Do we need more Power BI Premium Capacity?
value.excerpt: Capacity planning for Power BI Premium is not an exact science. How much capacity do you need? As with most things, it depends! Adam walks through some things to consider when thinking about your planning.  Premium Gen2 capacity load evaluation https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/admin/service-premium-concepts
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ipdMRPdXcWA" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Excel and OneDrive with Power BI For Collaboration
value.excerpt: In this 2 minute Tuesday, Patrick looks at how to use Excel and OneDrive with Power BI For Collaboration. Using this approach, you can easily keep Power BI updated when team members update an Excel spreadsheet hosted on OneDrive. This is a great alternative to using Google Sheets which can be painful

value.title: Expand lists in Power BI (also a look at M Syntax)
value.excerpt: I show how you can take a table that lists "Record" and expand that within Power BI. This also works with Power Query. I have a look at the M Syntax and show a cleaner approach.  SUBSCRIBE! https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCFp1vaKzpfvoGai0vE5VJ0w?sub_confirmation=1  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube

This video will show you the clicks to get to the clicky clicky draggy droppy awesomeness when working with big data, or even massive data.   Christian Wade on Twitter - @_christianWade  LET'S CONNECT!

value.title: No Calendar Table? How to add Fiscal Month and Sort in Power BI?

value.title: Power BI Desktop And Role-Playing Dimensions: Can you do it?
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick talks about Power BI Desktop and role-playing dimensions. Can you even do this in Power BI Desktop? Patrick shows you why one particular way is not recommended as it will cause trouble. And then show you how you can use DAX within Power BI Desktop to take this to the next level.

value.title: Power BI PowerShell and the Admin API
value.excerpt: The Power BI PowerShell and the Admin API allow you to quickly inventory your organization and manage workspaces and access. value.title: Power BI Tutorial: 4 Ways To Get Data
